bug.author: umbraclet16
bug.summary: Camera calibration tutorial code crashes when using video file as input
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 2.4.13 Operating System / Platform => Ubuntu 14.04 LTS 64 Bit Compiler => GCC 4.8.4
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
I try to use a video file to calibrate my camera with tutorial code samples/cpp/tutorial_code/calib3d/camera_calibration/camera_calibration.cpp. However the program seems to mistakenly parse the input as a XML file containing image lists. Message displayed:
OpenCV Error: Parsing error (xxx.mpg(0): Too long string or a lst string w/o newline) in icvXMLSkipSpaces, file /home/xxxxxxxx/modules/core/src/persistence.cpp, line 1838 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'cv::Exception'
<denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Modify the option in the configure XML file to video file name, and run the executable.
